title: [WIP] Add emulation for Serial Console
body:
This code is mostly based on CrosVM/Firecracker Serial implementation.

Still WIP.

Need to add/change:
- [ ] documentation
- [ ] comments with all the magic
- [ ] refine implementation of DeviceIo. IoAddress::PioAddress and IoAddress::MmmioAddress are making the implementation a bit weird.

title: Add device specific token to address different IO windows
body:
Device can have several PIO or MMIO address spaces like PCI BARs.
Besides, not all devices have to know exactly the base IO address and
only need to track the offset address of each IO window. This patch adds `token`
to uniquely identify the different IO windows when IO VMExit, so that
device can use `token` and `offset` to address the data handling.

title: Add IO manager support
body:
Let's firstly add IO manager which focuses on device Port IO and MMIO management, and static IO mapping in runtime as the first step. 
@sameo @andreeaflorescu  @jiangliu  PTAL, thanks.

title: Add interrupt traits and a KVM based implementation
body:
This PR add consts/structs/traits to manage interrupt sources for backend devices.
It also provides a KVM hypervisor based implementation for x86 legacy interrupts, PCI MSI/MSI-x interrupts.

title: Introduce Resources and ResourceRequest to vm-device
body:
Add two enum to  manage device resources.

The high level flow of resource management among the VMM, the device manager, and the device is as below:
* the VMM creates a new device object.
* the VMM asks the new device object for its resource requirements.
* the VMM allocates resources for the device object according to resource requirements.
* the VMM passes the allocated resources to the device object.
* the VMM registers the new device onto corresponding device managers according the allocated  resources.

title: Add interrupt subsystem to vm-device
body:
This PR adds two subsystem to the vm-device crate:
1) interrupt subsystem to manage interrupts for virtual devices.
2) the resource allocation interfaces between the vm-device crate and VMMs.

title: CODEOWNERS: Make PullAssigner the default owner
body:
The PullAssigner bot [1] will pick 2 github handles from the gate
keepers list [2] and assign them for reviewing any new PR.
The bot goes uses a round robin algorithm to select handles from the
list.

What happens when the CODEOWNERS file gets populated with real
owners? Following the PR review and approval process [3], the
PullAssigner bot will either pick only one or zero reviewers from the
gate keepers list, if the CODEOWNERS file points to exactly one or more
than one actual ownwer, respectively.

[1] https://pullpanda.com/assigner
[2] https://github.com/rust-vmm/community/blob/master/GATEKEEPERS.md
[3] https://github.com/rust-vmm/community#pr-review-and-approval

Signed-off-by: Samuel Ortiz <sameo@linux.intel.com>

title: DO_NOT_MERGE: a draft design for interrupt management
body:
This PR is a draft for interrupt management, which aims to decouple the vm-allocator crate from the vm-device crate.
@sboeuf @liujing2 @sameo @andreeaflorescu Please help to take a look at the proposal:)

title: vm-allocator design implementation
body:
@andreeaflorescu @sameo 
As discussed in the meeting on July 15th, I prepared vm-allocator patches from scratch. For easily reviewing, I split each functional module into separate commit. Let's quickly review the vm-allocator design for now and we can split them into several PRs later if we agree with the design.

BTW, I prefer to have an explicit repo for the vm-allocator PR later. :)

For quickly getting the information discussed before, some are listed as below.
- Proposal to implement system allocator in each VMM: 
https://github.com/rust-vmm/community/issues/33#issuecomment-511375675
https://github.com/rust-vmm/community/issues/33#issuecomment-511403087
- Proposal for spliting PR: https://github.com/rust-vmm/vm-device/pull/3#issuecomment-511389328

title: vm-device design codes
body:
This PR brings the basic vm-device design with

- The high level `Device trait` for abstraction and interface.
- A `DeviceManager` keeps track of all registered devices.
- README and test to see details.

Also, it includes vm-allocator crate codes, which provides system resources allocation APIs for other crates.
